title: Ping spikes prior to 6.24
body: Average ping before new patch was about 58-60, when patch hit i had to change my DNS server to start the game, the ping spikes started to range from 70 ping to 330 or more, reverting my DNS server did not fix problem.

replies.body:
Since patches only change local files within your League directory, they're *extremely unlikely* to affect your network connection, especially your latency. Big changes in latency like you're seeing are typically caused by routing changes at your ISP that change how long a path your connection takes to our servers. Before we take a look at your network routing, I recommend going through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) so we can verify all your local settings are 100% compatible with League.

Let me know if this resolved your issue.
Still acting like this is an exclusive problem to these 'few' people?  Clearly this is affecting multiple ISPs and is a MAJOR issue that Riot games needs to at least admit is a problem.
